design_audit.model_formula: later_wage_growth ~ earlier_wage_growth, OLS with HC1 SE
design_audit.selection_story: Regresses individual-level log-wage growth in a later career window on log-wage growth in an earlier career window using PSID panel data. Positive and significant slope indicates persistence in wage growth consistent with human capital accumulation through on-the-job training.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log-wage growth later in career (slope of log real wage on experience/age over a 5-year window)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Log-wage growth earlier in career (slope of log real wage on experience/age over a 5-year window)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Predictive power of early-career wage growth for later-career wage growth, evidence for systematic human capital investment heterogeneity
claim_object.target_population: Male PSID panel respondents with valid wage, age, experience, and schooling data across multiple survey waves

baseline_specs.label: WageGrowthCorrelation-Age-Baseline
baseline_specs.notes: Bivariate OLS of later wage growth (age-based) on earlier wage growth, baseline window: initial_age=30, nobs=4, yearahead=5. Corresponds to wagegrowthcorrelationlog55yrahead3035.m

constraints.notes: Bivariate regression; specification search varies window parameters, time variable (age vs experience), sample restrictions, and functional form.

canonical.notes: HC1 robust standard errors (bivariate OLS, no clustering needed)
